duplo_host.description: This is the base URL to the Duplo REST API.  It must be provided, but it can also be sourced from the `duplo_host` environment variable.

duplo_token.description: This is a bearer token used to authenticate to the Duplo REST API.  It must be provided, but it can also be sourced from the `duplo_token` environment variable.

ssl_no_verify.description: Disable SSL certificate verification. Defaults to `false`.

arn.description: The ARN of the dynamodb table.

attribute_type.description: The attribute type of the primary key attribute.

fullname.description: The full name of the dynamodb table.

key_type.description: The key type of the primary key.

name.description: The short name of the dynamodb table.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

primary_key_name.description: The attribute name of the primary key attribute.

status.description: The status of the dynamodb table.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the dynamodb table will be created in.

block.description: `duplocloud_aws_lambda_function` manages an AWS dynamodb table in Duplo.

arn.description: The ARN of the ElasticSearch instance.

domain_id.description: The domain ID of the ElasticSearch instance.

domain_name.description: The full name of the ElasticSearch instance.

elasticsearch_version.description: The version of the ElasticSearch instance. Defaults to `7.9`.

enable_node_to_node_encryption.description: Whether or not to use the enable node-to-node encryption for this ElasticSearch instance.

endpoints.description: The endpoints to use when connecting to the ElasticSearch instance.

name.description: The short name of the ElasticSearch instance.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `domain_name` attribute.

require_ssl.description: Whether or not to require SSL for accessing this ElasticSearch instance.

selected_zone.description: The numerical index of the zone to launch this ElasticSearch instance in.

storage_size.description: The storage volume size, in GB, for the ElasticSearch instance. Defaults to `20`.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the ElasticSearch instance will be created in.

use_latest_tls_cipher.description: Whether or not to use the latest TLS cipher for this ElasticSearch instance.

kms_key_id.description: The ID of a KMS key to use with the ElasticSearch instance.

kms_key_name.description: The name of a KMS key to use with the ElasticSearch instance.

block.description: The storage encryption settings for the ElasticSearch instance.
`duplocloud_aws_elasticsearch` manages an AWS ElasticSearch instance in Duplo.

agent_platform.description: The numeric ID of the container agent pool that this host is added to. Defaults to `0`.

allocated_public_ip.description: Whether or not to allocate a public IP. Defaults to `false`.

base64_user_data.description: Base64 encoded EC2 user data to associated with the host.

cloud.description: The numeric ID of the cloud provider to launch the host in. Defaults to `0`.

friendly_name.description: The short name of the host.

identity_role.description: The name of the IAM role associated with this host.

instance_id.description: The AWS EC2 instance ID of the host.

private_ip_address.description: The primary private IP address assigned to the host.

status.description: The current status of the host.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the host will be created in.

user_account.description:
The default username for the host.

Windows example: `Administrator`.

Amazon Linux example: `ec2-user`.

Ubuntu Linux example: `ubuntu`.

wait_until_connected.description: Whether or not to wait until Duplo can connect to the host, after creation. Defaults to `true`.

zone.description: The availability zone to launch the host in, expressed as a number and starting at 0. Defaults to `0`.

block.description: Configuration metadata used when creating the host.

associate_public_ip.description: Whether or not to associate a public IP with the newly created ENI.  Cannot be specified if `network_interface_id` is specified.

device_index.description: The device index to pass to AWS for attaching the ENI.  Starts at zero.

network_interface_id.description: The ID of an ENI to attach to this host.  Cannot be specified if `subnet_id` or `associate_public_ip` is specified.

subnet_id.description: The ID of a subnet in which to create a new ENI.  Cannot be specified if `network_interface_id` is specified.

block.description: An optional list of custom network interface configurations to use when creating the host.
`duplocloud_aws_host` manages a native AWS host in Duplo.

arn.description: The ARN of the Kafka cluster.

az_distribution.description: The availability zone distribution used by the cluster.

configuration_arn.description: An ARN of a Kafka configuration to apply to the cluster.

configuration_revision.description: An revision of a Kafka configuration to apply to the cluster.

fullname.description: The full name of the Kakfa cluster.

instance_type.description:
The Kafka node instance type to use.
See the [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/msk/latest/developerguide/msk-create-cluster.html) for more information.

kafka_version.description: The version of the Kafka cluster.

name.description: The short name of the Kafka cluster.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

plaintext_bootstrap_broker_string.description: The bootstrap broker connect string for plaintext (unencrypted) connections.

plaintext_zookeeper_connect_string.description: The Zookeeper connect string for plaintext (unencrypted) connections.

security_groups.description: The list of security groups used by the cluster.

state.description: The current state of the cluster.

storage_size.description: The size of the Kafka storage, in gigabytes.

subnets.description: The list of subnets that the cluster will be launched in.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the Kafka cluster will be created in.

tls_bootstrap_broker_string.description: The bootstrap broker connect string for TLS (encrypted) connections.

tls_zookeeper_connect_string.description: The Zookeeper connect string for TLS (encrypted) connections.

block.description: `duplocloud_aws_kafka_cluster` manages an AWS MSK cluster in Duplo.

arn.description: The ARN of the lambda function.

description.description: A description of the lambda function.

fullname.description: The full name of the lambda function.

handler.description: The [entrypoint](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/walkthrough-custom-events-create-test-function.html) of the lambda function in your code.

last_modified.description: A timestamp string of lambda's last modification time.

memory_size.description: The maximum amount of memory, in MB, that your lambda function is allowed to use at runtime. Defaults to `3`.

name.description: The short name of the lambda function cluster.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

role.description: The IAM role for the lambda function's execution.

runtime.description: The [runtime](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/lambda-runtimes.html) that the lambda function needs.

s3_bucket.description: The S3 bucket where the lambda function package is located.

s3_key.description: The S3 key in the S3 bucket where the lambda function package is located.

source_code_hash.description: The SHA 256 hash of the lambda functions's source code package.

source_code_size.description: The size in bytes of the lambda functions's source code package.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the lambda function will be created in.

timeout.description: The execution time limit for the lambda function. Defaults to `3`.

version.description: The version of the lambda function.

variables.description: Map of environment variables that are accessible from the function code during execution.

block.description: Allow customization of the lambda execution environment.
`duplocloud_aws_lambda_function` manages an AWS lambda function in Duplo.

arn.description: The ARN of the load balancer.

drop_invalid_headers.description: Whether or not the load balancer should drop invalid HTTP headers.

enable_access_logs.description: Whether or not access logs should be enabled.

fullname.description: The full name of the load balancer.

is_internal.description: Whether or not the load balancer is internal (non internet-facing).

name.description: The short name of the load balancer.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

tags.description: The tags assigned to this load balancer.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the load balancer will be created in.

web_acl_id.description: The ARN of a WAF to attach to the load balancer.

block.description: `duplocloud_aws_load_balancer` manages an AWS application load balancer in Duplo.

agent_platform.description: The numeric ID of the container agent to use for deployment. Defaults to `0`.

cloud.description: The numeric ID of the cloud provider to launch the service in. Defaults to `0`.

docker_image.description: The docker image to use for the launched container(s).

name.description: The name of the service to create.

replicas.description: The number of container replicas to deploy.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the service will be created in.

block.description:
`duplocloud_duplo_service` manages a container-based service in Duplo.

NOTE: For Amazon ECS services, see the `duplocloud_ecs_service` resource.

replication_controller_name.description: The name of the duplo service.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that hosts the duplo service.

wait_until_ready.description: Whether or not to wait until Duplo considers all of the load balancers ready Defaults to `true`.

certificate_arn.description: The ARN of an ACM certificate to associate with this load balancer.  Only applicable for HTTPS.

external_port.description: The frontend port associated with this load balancer configuration.

external_traffic_policy.description: Only for K8S Node Port (`lb_type = 4`).  Set the kubernetes service `externalTrafficPolicy` attribute.

health_check_url.description: The health check URL to associate with this load balancer configuration.

is_internal.description: Whether or not to create an internal load balancer.

lb_type.description:
The numerical index of the type of load balancer configuration to create.
Should be one of:

   - `0` : ELB (Classic Load Balancer)
   - `1` : ALB (Application Load Balancer)
   - `2` : Health-check Only (No Load Balancer)
   - `3` : K8S Service w/ Cluster IP (No Load Balancer)
   - `4` : K8S Service w/ Node Port (No Load Balancer)

port.description: The backend port associated with this load balancer configuration.

protocol.description: The frontend protocol associated with this load balancer configuration.

replication_controller_name.description: Set the replication_controller_name field instead of lbconfigs.replication_controller_name

block.description:
`duplocloud_duplo_service_lbconfigs` manages load balancer configuration(s) for a container-based service in Duplo.

NOTE: For Amazon ECS services, see the `duplocloud_ecs_service` resource.

dns_prfx.description: The DNS prefix to assign to this service's load balancer.

drop_invalid_headers.description: Whether or not to drop invalid HTTP headers received by the load balancer.

enable_access_logs.description: Whether or not to enable access logs.  When enabled, Duplo will send access logs to a centralized S3 bucket per plan

replication_controller_name.description: The name of the duplo service.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that hosts the duplo service.

webaclid.description: The ARN of a web application firewall to associate this load balancer.

block.description:
`duplocloud_duplo_service_lbconfigs` manages additional configuration for a container-based service in Duplo.

NOTE: For Amazon ECS services, see the `duplocloud_ecs_service` resource.

arn.description: The ARN of the elasticache instance.

auth_token.description: Set a password for authenticating to the ElastiCache instance.  Only supported if `encryption_in_transit` is to to `true`.

cache_type.description:
The numerical index of elasticache instance type.
Should be one of:

   - `0` : Redis
   - `1` : Memcache

 Defaults to `0`.

endpoint.description: The endpoint of the elasticache instance.

host.description: The DNS hostname of the elasticache instance.

identifier.description: The full name of the elasticache instance.

instance_status.description: The status of the elasticache instance.

name.description: The short name of the elasticache instance.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `identifier` attribute.

port.description: The listening port of the elasticache instance.

replicas.description: The number of replicas to create. Defaults to `1`.

size.description:
The instance type of the elasticache instance.
See AWS documentation for the [available instance types](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/red-ug/CacheNodes.SupportedTypes.html).

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the elasticache instance will be created in.

block.description: `duplocloud_ecache_instance` manages an ElastiCache instance in Duplo.

dns_prfx.description: The DNS prefix to assign to this service's load balancer.

name.description: The name of the service to create.

old_task_definition_buffer_size.description: The number of older task definitions to retain in AWS. Defaults to `10`.

replicas.description: The number of container replicas to create.

task_definition.description: The ARN of the task definition to use.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the service will be created in.

backend_protocol.description: The backend protocol associated with this load balancer configuration.

certificate_arn.description: The ARN of an ACM certificate to associate with this load balancer.  Only applicable for HTTPS.

drop_invalid_headers.description: Whether or not to drop invalid HTTP headers received by the load balancer.

enable_access_logs.description: Whether or not to enable access logs.  When enabled, Duplo will send access logs to a centralized S3 bucket per plan

external_port.description: The frontend port associated with this load balancer configuration.

health_check_url.description: The health check URL to associate with this load balancer configuration.

is_internal.description: Whether or not to create an internal load balancer. Defaults to `false`.

lb_type.description:
The numerical index of the type of load balancer configuration to create.
Should be one of:

   - `0` : ELB (Classic Load Balancer)
   - `1` : ALB (Application Load Balancer)
   - `2` : Health-check Only (No Load Balancer)

port.description: The backend port associated with this load balancer configuration.

protocol.description: The frontend protocol associated with this load balancer configuration.

webaclid.description: The ARN of a web application firewall to associate this load balancer.

block.description: Zero or more load balancer configurations to associate with this service.
`duplocloud_ecs_service` manages a Amazon ECS service in Duplo.

arn.description: The ARN of the task definition.

family.description: The name of the task definition to create.

revision.description: The current revision of the task definition.

status.description: The status of the task definition.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the task definition will be created in.

block.description: `duplocloud_ecs_task_definition` manages a Amazon ECS task definition in Duplo.

applications.description: Emr - list of applications to be installed.

bootstrap_actions.description: Emr - list of bootstrap_actions to be installed.

configurations.description: Emr - list of application configurations to be updated.

full_name.description: full_name - Duplo will add a prefix to the name.

keep_job_flow_alive_when_no_steps.description: Keep Job Flow Alive When No Steps. Emr Cluster will be terminated if true. Defaults to `true`.

master_instance_type.description: Emr MasterInstanceType. Supported InstanceTypes e.g. m4.large

name.description: The short name of the emrCluster.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

scale_down_behavior.description: Emr scale_down_behavior. Specifies the way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized.

slave_instance_type.description: Emr SlaveInstanceType. Supported InstanceTypes e.g. m4.large

step_concurrency_level.description: Emr Cluster step_concurrency_level settings. Defaults to `1`.

steps.description: Emr - list of steps to be run after cluster is ready.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the emrCluster will be created in.

visible_to_all_users.description: Emr Cluster visible to all users settings.

block.description: `duplocloud_emr_cluster` manages an AWS emrCluster in Duplo.

allow_unauthenticated.description: Whether or not to allow unauthenticated invocations. Defaults to `false`.

available_memory_mb.description: The amount of memory available to the cloud function. Defaults to `256`.

build_environment_variables.description: The build environment variables for this cloud function.

build_id.description: The ID of the cloud build that built the cloud function.

description.description: The description of the cloud function.

entrypoint.description: The entry point of the cloud function.

environment_variables.description: The environment variables for this cloud function.

fullname.description: The full name of the cloud function.

ingress_type.description:
The numerical index of ingress type to use for this cloud function.
Should be one of:

   - `1` : Allow all
   - `2` : Allow internal traffic
   - `3` : Allow internal traffic and GCP load balancing
 Defaults to `1`.

labels.description: The labels assigned to this cloud function.

name.description: The short name of the cloud function.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

require_https.description: Whether or not to require HTTPS. Defaults to `true`.

runtime.description:
The runtime of the cloud function.
Should be one of:

 - `nodejs10` : Node.js 10
 - `nodejs12` : Node.js 12
 - `nodejs14` : Node.js 14
 - `python37` : Python 3.7
 - `python38` : Python 3.8
 - `python39` : Python 3.9
 - `go111` :    Go 1.11
 - `go113` :    Go 1.13
 - `java11` :   Java 11
 - `dotnet3` :  .NET Framework 3
 - `ruby26` :   Ruby 2.6
 - `ruby27` :   Ruby 2.7
 - `nodejs6` :  Node.js 6 (deprecated)
 - `nodejs8` :  Node.js 8 (deprecated)

self_link.description: The SelfLink of the cloud function.

source_archive_url.description: The cloud storage URL where the cloud function package is located.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the cloud function will be created in.

timeout.description: The execution time limit for the cloud function. Defaults to `60`.

version_id.description: The current version of the cloud function.

vpc_networking_type.description:
The numerical index of the VPC networking type to use for this cloud function.
Should be one of:

   - `0` : All traffic through the VPC
   - `1` : Only private traffic through the VPC
   - `2` : No VPC networking
 Defaults to `0`.

event_type.description: The type of event that will trigger the function

resource.description: The resource that will trigger the function

service.description: The service that will trigger the function

block.description: Specifies an event trigger for the cloud function.

enabled.description: Must be set to `true`. Defaults to `true`.

security_level.description: The security level of the HTTPS trigger

url.description: The URL of the HTTPS trigger

block.description: Specifies an HTTPS trigger for the cloud function.
`duplocloud_gcp_cloud_function` manages a GCP cloud function in Duplo.

fullname.description: The full name of the pubsub topic.

labels.description: The labels assigned to this pubsub topic.

name.description: The short name of the pubsub topic.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

self_link.description: The SelfLink of the pubsub topic.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the pubsub topic will be created in.

attempt_deadline.description: The attempt deadline for the scheduler job.

description.description: The description of the scheduler job.

fullname.description: The full name of the scheduler job.

name.description: The short name of the scheduler job.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

schedule.description: The desired schedule, in cron format.

self_link.description: The SelfLink of the scheduler job.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the scheduler job will be created in.

timezone.description: The timezone used to determine the schedule, in UNIX format

body.description: The HTTP request body to send.

block.description: Specifies App Engine routing.
Specifies an App Engine target for the scheduler job.

body.description: The HTTP request body to send.

enabled.description: Must be set to `true`. Defaults to `true`.

service_account_email.description: The OAuth token service account email.

block.description: Specifies OAuth authentication.

enabled.description: Must be set to `true`. Defaults to `true`.

service_account_email.description: The OIDC token service account email.

block.description: Specifies OIDC authentication.
Specifies an HTTP target for the scheduler job.

attributes.description: The attributes to send to the pubsub target.

data.description: The data to send to the pubsub topic.

topic_name.description: The name of the topic to target

block.description: Specifies a pubsub target for the scheduler job.
`duplocloud_gcp_scheduler_job` manages a GCP scheduler job in Duplo.

allow_public_access.description: Whether or not public access might be allowed for the storage bucket. Defaults to `false`.

enable_versioning.description: Whether or not versioning is enabled for the storage bucket. Defaults to `false`.

fullname.description: The full name of the storage bucket.

labels.description: The labels assigned to this storage bucket.

name.description: The short name of the storage bucket.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

self_link.description: The SelfLink of the storage bucket.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the storage bucket will be created in.

block.description: `duplocloud_gcp_storage_bucket` manages a GCP storage bucket in Duplo.

address_prefix.description: The CIDR to use for the VPC or VNet.

azcount.description: The number of availability zones.  Must be one of: `2`, `3`, or `4`.

cloud.description:
The numerical index of cloud provider to use for the infrastructure.
Should be one of:

   - `0` : AWS
   - `2` : Azure
 Defaults to `0`.

enable_k8_cluster.description: Whether or not to provision a kubernetes cluster.

infra_name.description: The name of the infrastructure.  Infrastructure names are globally unique and less than 13 characters.

private_subnets.description: The private subnets for the VPC or VNet.

public_subnets.description: The public subnets for the VPC or VNet.

region.description: The cloud provider region.  The Duplo portal must have already been configured to support this region.

subnet_cidr.description: The CIDR subnet size (in bits) for the automatically created subnets.

block.description: `duplocloud_infrastructure` manages a tenant in Duplo.

data.description: A JSON encoded string representing the configmap data. You can use the `jsonencode()` function to build this from JSON.

metadata.description: A JSON encoded string representing the configmap metadata. You can use the `jsondecode()` function to parse this, if needed.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the configmap will be created in.

block.description: `duplocloud_k8_config_map` manages a kubernetes configmap in a Duplo tenant.

secret_data.description: A JSON encoded string representing the secret metadata. You can use the `jsonencode()` function to convert map or object data, if needed.

secret_type.description: The type of the secret.  Usually `"Opaque"`.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the secret will be created in.

block.description: `duplocloud_k8_secret` manages a kubernetes secret in a Duplo tenant.

certificates.description: A complete list of certificates for this plan, even ones not being managed by this resource.

delete_unspecified_certificates.description: Whether or not this resource should delete any certificates not specified by this resource. **WARNING:**  It is not recommended to change the default value of `false`. Defaults to `false`.

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to configure.

specified_certificates.description: A list of certificate names being managed by this resource.

block.description: A list of certificates to manage.

`duplocloud_plan_certificates` manages the list of certificates avaialble to a plan in Duplo.

This resource allows you take control of individual plan certificates for a specific plan.

configs.description: A complete list of configs for this plan, even ones not being managed by this resource.

delete_unspecified_configs.description: Whether or not this resource should delete any configs not specified by this resource. **WARNING:**  It is not recommended to change the default value of `false`. Defaults to `false`.

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to configure.

specified_configs.description: A list of config keys being managed by this resource.

block.description: A list of configs to manage.

`duplocloud_plan_configs` manages the list of configs avaialble to a plan in Duplo.

This resource allows you take control of individual configs for a specific plan.

delete_unspecified_images.description: Whether or not this resource should delete any images not specified by this resource. **WARNING:**  It is not recommended to change the default value of `false`. Defaults to `false`.

images.description: A complete list of images for this plan, even ones not being managed by this resource.

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to configure.

specified_images.description: A list of image names being managed by this resource.

block.description: A list of images to manage.

`duplocloud_plan_images` manages the list of images avaialble to a plan in Duplo.

This resource allows you take control of individual images for a specific plan.

arn.description: The ARN of the RDS instance.

encrypt_storage.description: Whether or not to encrypt the RDS instance storage.

endpoint.description: The endpoint of the RDS instance.

engine.description:
The numerical index of database engine to use the for the RDS instance.
Should be one of:

   - `0` : MySQL
   - `1` : PostgreSQL
   - `2` : MsftSQL-Express
   - `3` : MsftSQL-Standard
   - `8` : Aurora-MySQL
   - `9` : Aurora-PostgreSQL
   - `10` : MsftSQL-Web
   - `11` : Aurora-Serverless-MySql
   - `12` : Aurora-Serverless-PostgreSql
   - `13` : DocumentDB

engine_version.description:
The database engine version to use the for the RDS instance.
If you don't know the available engine versions for your RDS instance, you can use the [AWS CLI](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/rds/describe-db-engine-versions.html) to retrieve a list.

host.description: The DNS hostname of the RDS instance.

identifier.description: The full name of the RDS instance.

instance_status.description: The current status of the RDS instance.

master_password.description: The master password of the RDS instance.

master_username.description: The master username of the RDS instance.

name.description: The short name of the RDS instance.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `identifier` attribute.

parameter_group_name.description: A RDS parameter group name to apply to the RDS instance.

port.description: The listening port of the RDS instance.

size.description:
The instance type of the RDS instance.
See AWS documentation for the [available instance types](https://aws.amazon.com/rds/instance-types/).

snapshot_id.description: A database snapshot to initialize the RDS instance from, at launch.

store_details_in_secret_manager.description: Whether or not to store RDS details in the AWS secrets manager.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the RDS instance will be created in.

block.description: `duplocloud_rds_instance` manages an AWS RDS instance in Duplo.

allow_public_access.description: Whether or not to remove the public access block from the bucket.

arn.description: The ARN of the S3 bucket.

enable_access_logs.description: Whether or not to enable access logs.  When enabled, Duplo will send access logs to a centralized S3 bucket per plan

enable_versioning.description: Whether or not to enable versioning.

fullname.description: The full name of the S3 bucket.

managed_policies.description:
Duplo can manage your S3 bucket policy for you, based on simple list of policy keywords:

 - `"ssl"`: Require SSL / HTTPS when accessing the bucket.
 - `"ignore"`: If this key is present, Duplo will not manage your bucket policy.

name.description: The short name of the S3 bucket.  Duplo will add a prefix to the name.  You can retrieve the full name from the `fullname` attribute.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the S3 bucket will be created in.

method.description: Default encryption method.  Must be one of: `None`, `Sse`, `AwsKms`, `TenantKms`. Defaults to `Sse`.

block.description: Default encryption settings for objects uploaded to the bucket.

account_name.description: The name of the tenant.  Tenant names are globally unique, less than 13 characters, and cannot be a prefix of any other tenant name.

plan_id.description: The name of the plan under which the tenant will be created.

tenant_id.description: A GUID identifying the tenant.  This is automatically generated by Duplo.

block.description: `duplocloud_tenant` manages a tenant in Duplo.

delete_unspecified_settings.description: Whether or not this resource should delete any settings not specified by this resource. **WARNING:**  It is not recommended to change the default value of `false`. Defaults to `false`.

metadata.description: A complete list of configuration settings for this tenant, even ones not being managed by this resource.

specified_settings.description: A list of configuration setting key being managed by this resource.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant to configure.

block.description: A list of configuration settings to manage, expressed as key / value pairs.

`duplocloud_tenant_config` manages a tenant's configuration in Duplo.

Tenant configuration is initially populated by Duplo when a tenant is created.  This resource allows you take control of individual configuration settings for a specific tenant.

from_port.description: The start of a port range to allow traffic to. Defaults to `0`.

protocol.description: The network protocol.  Must be one of:  `tcp`, `udp`, `icmp` Defaults to `tcp`.

source_address.description: The source CIDR block to allow traffic from. Only one of `source_tenant` or `source_address` may be specified.

source_tenant.description: The source tenant name (*not* GUID) to allow traffic from. Only one of `source_tenant` or `source_address` may be specified.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the network security rule will be created in.

to_port.description: The end of a port range to allow traffic to. Defaults to `65535`.

block.description: `duplocloud_tenant_network_security_rule` manages a single network single rule for a Duplo tenant.

arn.description: The ARN of the created secret.

data.description: The plaintext secret data. You can use the `jsonencode()` function to store JSON data in this field.

name.description: The full name of the secret.

name_suffix.description: The short name of the secret. You can get the fullname from the `name` attribute after creation.

rotation_enabled.description: Whether or not rotation is enabled for this secret.

tags.description: A list of tags for this secret.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the secret will be created in.

block.description: `duplocloud_tenant_secret` manages a tenant secret in Duplo.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant in which to list the hosts.

block.description: `duplocloud_emr_cluster` lists EmrClusters in a Duplo tenant.

address_prefix.description: The CIDR for the VPC or VNet.

azcount.description: The number of availability zones.  Will be one of: `2`, `3`, or `4`.

cloud.description:
The numerical index of cloud provider to use for the infrastructure.
Will be one of:

   - `0` : AWS
   - `2` : Azure

enable_k8_cluster.description: Whether or not a kubernetes cluster is provisioned.

infra_name.description: The name of the infrastructure to look up. Must be specified if `tenant_id` is blank.

private_subnets.description: The private subnets for the VPC or VNet.

public_subnets.description: The public subnets for the VPC or VNet.

region.description: The cloud provider region.  The Duplo portal must have already been configured to support this region.

subnet_cidr.description: The CIDR subnet size (in bits) of the automatically created subnets.

tenant_id.description: The ID of the tenant to look up the infrastructure for. Must be specified if `infra_name` is blank.

block.description: `duplocloud_infrastructure` retrieves details of an infrastructure in Duplo.
`duplocloud_infrastructures` retrieves a list of infrastructures in Duplo.

data.description: A JSON encoded string representing the configmap data. You can use the `jsondecode()` function to parse this, if needed.

metadata.description: A JSON encoded string representing the configmap metadata. You can use the `jsondecode()` function to parse this, if needed.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant that the configmap will be created in.

block.description: `duplocloud_k8_config_map` reads data from a single kubernetes configmap in a Duplo tenant.
`duplocloud_k8_config_maps` lists all kubernetes configmaps in a Duplo tenant.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant in which to list the hosts.

block.description: `duplocloud_native_hosts` lists native hosts in a Duplo tenant.

certificates.description: Plan certificates that can be attached to load balancers

cloud.description:
The numerical index of the cloud provider for this planWill be one of:

   - `0` : AWS
   - `2` : Azure
   - `3` : GCP

images.description: Plan images that can be used to launch native hosts

kms_keys.description: Plan KMS keys that can be used for cloud-based encryption

private_subnet_ids.description: The private subnets for the VPC or VNet.

public_subnet_ids.description: The public subnets for the VPC or VNet.

waf_infos.description: Plan web application firewalls that can be attached to load balancers

block.description: `duplocloud_plan` retrieves details of a plan in Duplo.
`duplocloud_plan_image` retrieves details of a specific image for a given plan.

images.description: The list of images for this plan.

block.description: `duplocloud_plan_imagess` retrieves a list of images for a given plan.
`duplocloud_plans` retrieves a list of plans from Duplo.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant.

block.description: The `duplocloud_tenant_external_subnets` data source retrieves a list of tenant's external subnet IDs.

tenant_id.description: The GUID of the tenant.

block.description: The `duplocloud_tenant_internal_subnets` data source retrieves a list of tenant's internal subnet IDs.
